project_name: UPM-Hz - Kyndryl Warwick Generator No.2 Linkage Issue
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):cancelled by Bilal (2):sor submitted / draft by Miss Maymie Sporer

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: Generator No.2  engine fuel injector linkage rods have seized on the set preventing the Diesel from shutting down when given the command via the PLC System
scope_of_work.scope: Specialist contractor to attend site and replace linkage rods across the set to ensure that this is no longer an issue which will then enable safe shutdown of the Generator when it is instructed to do so.
scope_of_work.justification: Generator No.2 is isolated while this issue is present, we are not able to shutdown with this issue so it will remain isolated until it has been repaired
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Generator No.2 will remain offline until this issue has been resolved

status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):cancelled by Bilal (2):offer approved by Miss Maymie Sporer (3):offer submitted by Miss Maymie Sporer (4):sor submitted / draft by Flo Hodkiewicz

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: Whilst CHW Pump 1 was being overhauled after failure, a brief examination was taken of CHW pumps 2,3 & 4, it was advised that the pumps would require a overhaul as they run on a 24/7 rotation schedule. CHW Pump No.1 had water spilling out of side of pump due to bellow failure this was luckily captured during works otherwise the impact could have resulted in loss of Chilled Water to the DC Suites, as all pumps have similar runs hours and same age the OEM has advised Pumps 2, 3 & 4 are overhauled to prevent same issue occurring. Katana Exposure ID - GBWARWCK-SE27636, Kyndryl IPWC Risk Register Reference - New 27.
scope_of_work.scope:
CBRE along with Grundfos, would re-sequence the pump to standby position then isolate electrically and mechanically, so the Grundfos engineers could strip down and replace shaft seals o rings and bearings. Once completed they will then reinstate power and water flow and realign the pump. this would then have a test of an hour and alignment would then be checked again.
This process will happen on all 3 pumps on one visit over a weeks period
scope_of_work.justification: If the Overhauls are not carried out on CHW pumps 2, 3,& 4, with the state they are currently operating in, they could fail as CHW pump 1 previously did. This could then result in a lack of water flow to the chillers which may shut down due to low flow, this could then create the data suites to overheat and have a major impact upon the IT equipment located in the suites.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Non approval of this request to overhaul the PH1 CHW Pumps 2, 3 & 4 with new shaft seals o rings, bearings, and alignment could result in failure due to the condition and run hours they have been put under since installation, this could then result in loss of flow for the chillers resulting in the chillers shutting down stopping the cooling to the Ph1 areas.

project_name: UPM- Kyndryl Warwick Fire Extinguisher replacements
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):cancelled by Bilal (2):sor submitted / draft by Brando Dooley DDS

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: Following the annual Fire Extinguisher service it was found that a number of Fire Extinguishers / Fire Blankets have reached their end of life and are no longer operable due to defect or age.
scope_of_work.scope: Replacement of 35 Extinguishers with Critical Defects that renders a system inoperative, due to extinguishers reaching  end of life.
scope_of_work.justification: A correctly maintained fire extinguisher acts as the first line of defense against small fires, allowing fire trained employees to quickly contain and extinguish flames before they have a chance to grow. Early intervention can significantly reduce the risk of injury, property damage, and business disruption.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: All fire safety legislation in England and Wales for non-domestic premises is covered by the Regulatory Reform (Fire Safety) Order 2005 (RRO), which states that appropriate fire-fighting equipment, including portable fire extinguishers, must be provided where there is any risk of fire.

scope_of_work.problem: Following intruders gaining access to the site recently where earth cables were damaged and removed from the site illegally.
scope_of_work.scope:
Supply and apply anti climb security paint also known as anti-intruder or anti-vandal paint. One of the most economical, effective and long lasting ways of deterring unwanted intruders. 
CBRE self perform to apply the anti-climb paint and repair damaged section of old fence to stop/deter access to the main fence. 
Installation of addition LED lighting in the area to be carried out at the same time.
scope_of_work.justification: Increased security to prevent further future intrusion to site by vandals.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Further intrusion by vandals who have the intention of causing damage to site equipment and services.

project_name: UPM-Hz Kyndryl Warwick - Cooling Tower 1A Single Fan Replacement
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):cancelled by Bilal (2):sor submitted / draft by Flo Hodkiewicz

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: The cooling towers have 3 fan sections in total, a twin and single fan. On Cooling tower 1A the bearings on the single fan section have broken down. New fan blades, shaft and bearings required.
scope_of_work.scope: Pre-chlorination tower. Isolate and drain tower. Specialist to install new fan blades, shaft and bearings. Test fans operation, refill tower pond,  post tower chlorination and restore to normal operation.
scope_of_work.justification: Towers are utilized to reject DC heat to the atmosphere to maintain desired temperature. Reduced resilience, all towers fully utilized in the summer warmest periods.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Increased business risk if other towers fail and significantly long replacement component lead times

project_name: UPM-Hz - DRUPS Loadbank Requirement for April Major Service & Quarterly Load Run
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):cancelled by Bilal (2):sor submitted / draft by Jayme Feil

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: DRUPS is due it's next quarterly load run at >35% load in April 2024 during the major service by Hitec. Current business load does not provide enough load so the hire of a 600kW load bank is required
scope_of_work.scope: Hire and connection, disconnection of 600kW load bank with inline 1250A MCCB issue of PTWs/ICs Delivery of load bank
scope_of_work.justification: Maintain the DRUPS generator reliability and prevent wet stacking of generators due to low load conditions. The load run must also be >35% for 1 hour as the fuel filter is replaced on the service and this ensures all air is removed from the diesel circuit
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Increased risk of generator failure, reduction of DRUPS reliability
